glsa.title: rxvt-unicode: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in rxvt-unicode may allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: rxvt-unicode (urxvt) is a clone of the rxvt terminal emulator.

description.p: rxvt-unicode does not properly handle OSC escape sequences, including those used to read and write X window properties.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to run a specially crafted file using rxvt-unicode, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All rxvt-unicode users should upgrade to the latest version:
